list_definition.definition: to become well again; to return to good health etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He is recovering from a serious illness
The country is recovering from an economic crisis.
The police have recovered the stolen jewels
He will recover the cost of the repairs through the insurance.

list_definition.definition: to get control of (one’s actions, emotions etc) again

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The actor almost fell over, but quickly recovered (his balance).

list_ex_of_english: In addition, we recovered other embryos after storage of up to 18 months in liquid nitrogen to provide information on mutation during storage.
Despite the large numbers of anurans examined from the various locations in these zones (table 1), no polystomatids were recovered from these hosts.
During the performance, he recovers and begins to enjoy himself, though he collapses again directly afterward.
The losses are ones that cannot be recovered in the natural world.
In contrast, distinct vitelline follicles were present in 6-week-old flukes recovered from the bile duct.
The author suggested that this animal might have recovered normal eye alignment.
Upon backtracking, it is possible that heap space can be recovered in the aging space and even in the old generation through instant reclaiming.
After 4 weeks, the follicles that had grown to the antral stage were recovered.
